channel.title: jekyll on Development Cheat Sheets
channel.description: Recent content in jekyll on Development Cheat Sheets

item.title: Migrating from Jekyll to Hugo
item.description: This post contains information about the migration of my Github development-cheat-sheets page (this site) from Jekyll.

item.title: Jekyll
item.description: Jekyll is a Ruby tool which can generate static websites and blogs using plain text files.

item.title: MarkDown
item.description: Markdown is a lightweight markup language with plain-text-formatting syntax. Its design allows it to be converted to many output formats.

item.title: Ruby
item.description: Ruby is an interpreted, high-level, general-purpose programming language which supports multiple programming paradigms. It was designed with an emphasis on programming productivity and simplicity. In Ruby, everything is an object, including primitive data types.
